info.description: This is the REST API documentation for Workday Custom Tasks. A custom task provides UI integration from Workday to an external application page. It can be used as a related action or search result to navigate from Workday to the external app. It can also be used to display external content within Workday, as a Worklet or as a tab in a Profile Group. You can use the API supported operations here to create and maintain custom tasks in your Workday system.
info.title: Custom Tasks

get.description: Get all custom task definitions. Secured by: Custom Task

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of instances to retrieve

200.description: OK. All custom task definitions successfully returned, limited by any query parameters

schema.description: A collection of custom task objects

post.description: Create a new custom task definition. Secured by: Custom Task

201.description: OK. The custom task was successfully created

get.description:
Get a specific custom task. {id} can be a wid, or be of the form "Custom_Task_ID={customTaskId}".
Secured by: Custom Task.

200.description: OK. The custom task was returned

put.description:
Update a specific custom task. {id} can be a wid, or be of the form "Custom_Task_ID={customTaskId}".
Secured by: Custom Task.

200.description: OK. The custom task was updated

id.description: The Workday id of the custom task

title.description: The task title, presented to the user in search results and as a related action

customTaskId.description: The Reference ID to use for lookups. When creating a new custom task, this will be auto-created based on the _title_, if not otherwise specified.

routePath.description:
The route path to the application page. There are two substitution variables
that can pass data as query parameter values from Workday to your application
page. They are: 
- "customTaskObjectId", replaced with the wid of the selected
  _businessObject_ instance, if any
- "taskTitle", replaced with the _title_ of the invoked
  custom task

securedSelection.description:
Set to _true_ to prompt for a secured instance of the _businessObject_.
Context-aware security groups will be evaluated against the instance.

unsecuredSelection.description:
Set to _true_ to prompt for an unsecured instance of the _businessObject_.
Any instance of the _businessObject_ can be selected.

noSelection.description: Set to _true_ if no instance of the _businessObject_ is to be selected.

domains.description: The domains providing security group permissions for this task.

testOnly.description: Set to _true_ if task is to be restricted to a set of _testUsers_. No other users will have access to the task.

testUsers.description: Workday accounts authorized to run the task while in testOnly mode

businessObject.description:
The business object that is the subject of this task. Set *one* of these custom task fields to true to define the behavior of the task:
* _securedSelection_
* _unsecuredSelection_
* _noSelection_

(Not all selection options are available for all business objects.)
